DataElement.preferredName: Substance Extraction Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Target Anatomic Site Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of extracting something from an associated study subject for the purpose of the extracted product to be administered to a study subject. EXAMPLE(S): A donor giving Bone Marrow Stem Cells for a Stem Cell Transplant NOTE(S): The study subject could be the same for the extraction and the intended administration. This is different than a performed specimen collection, in that the intent is different: This is a donation. A coded value specifying the anatomic location that is the focus of a procedure. EXAMPLE(S): Kidney (or a nephrectomy) NOTE(S): (1) Multiple contiguous sites within the same organ system may be referenced. (2) Anatomic site and laterality both are included in this concept.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Extraction Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Target Anatomic Site Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.:The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:Named locations of or within the body.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
